commonroad_crime.measure.probability package

Submodules

commonroad_crime.measure.probability.p_mc module

class commonroad_crime.measure.probability.p_mc.P_MC(config: CriMeConfiguration)

Bases: CriMeBase

P-MC produces a collision probability estimation based on future evolutions from a Monte Carlo path planning prediction.

See Broadhurst, Adrian, Simon Baker, and Takeo Kanade. “Monte Carlo road safety reasoning.” IEEE Proceedings of Intelligent Vehicles Symposium IEEE, 2005.

clcs: CurvilinearCoordinateSystem
compute(time_step: int = 0, vehicle_id=None, verbose: bool = True)

Specific computing function for each measure

ego_vehicle: DynamicObstacle
measure_name: Enum = 'collision probability via Monte Carlo'
monotone: Enum = 'positive monotonic'
monte_carlo_simulation(vehicle: DynamicObstacle, maneuver: Maneuver, nr_samples: int)

Monte Carlo simulation of the given vehicle. :param vehicle: dynamic obstacles :param maneuver: maneuver of vehicle :param nr_samples: number of samples

other_vehicle: Union[Obstacle, DynamicObstacle, StaticObstacle, None]
rnd: Union[MPRenderer, None]
visualize(figsize: tuple = (25, 15))

Visualize the result, which will be measure-dependent.
